page.title: 07E. CHARMINSTER - WILDLIFE 1
page.content: Such rural surroundings as are found in this area support an abundance of wildlife. Since there are no roads, and hence no traffic noise to disturb the peace, the observant walker is usually well rewarded. Rabbits and hares are probably the most common animals and therefore most frequently seen; foxes, too, slinking from one field to another, apparently quite unconcerned at the daylight. There is evidence of badger activity in several places, although it has to be a night-time vigil if you want to watch them unobserved. Large herds of deer move across the area from Puddletown Woods, using the copses as daylight cover and often grazing along the edges of the fields. One farmer hires two hunters from Belgium to cull the deer as and when necessary.
